intro: Eritrichium minutiflorum, commonly known as the dwarf forget-me-not, is a small flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arid environments. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Eritrichium minutiflorum is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
